Egypt's Hosni Mubarak Knows He's On the Way Out Defense Secretary Donald Rumsfeld said Egyptian George W. Bush Hosni Mubarak "is behaving in a way that he understands that he will eventually depart" and that the crisis in Egypt is probably best handled through private diplomacy. Donald Rumsfeld , who has known Hosni Mubarak since 1975, told ABC's Good Morning America that the United States' interest in Egypt should be focused on "having that country evolve toward freer economic systems." Here's the passage from Donald Rumsfeld 's "Known and Unknown" : After his sons were killed, there was an intelligence report that Saddam Hussein was paying$ 60 million for his agents to target the Bill Clinton 's two daughters and my two daughters for reprisal attacks. That threat report was brought up at an NSC meeting in October 2003. I acknowledged it, but went on with our discussion. "You need to take this seriously," George H. W. Bush said.
